bill.title: Securities Transactions
bill.description: Requiring the Financial Services Commission to define the term "accredited investor"; exempting the offer and sale of an issuer's own securities from registration requirements if certain conditions are met; requiring such issuers to file certain information with the Office of Financial Regulation within a certain timeframe; authorizing issuers or their authorized persons to communicate with prospective investors to determine their interest in a contemplated security offering; deleting a limit on, and the commission's rulemaking authority to fix, maximum compensation in connection with the sale or offering of securities; revising prohibited acts of dealers and associated persons without required registration; specifying continuing education requirements for associated persons of investment advisers and federal covered advisers, etc.

history.action: Referred to Banking and Insurance; Appropriations Committee on Agriculture, Environment, and General Government; Fiscal Policy
